A picture is worth a thousand words and this one truly shares the mixed emotions many of us are feeling in this topsy-turvey time. This is one of our students in an empty classroom picking up her things since we are expected to be closed for the rest of the school year. She wanted her mom to take one last picture of the classroom... and just cried.

School is not over, but this week we have opened up the building for students and families to pick up personal items.
It has been bittersweet for sure. It has been awesome to have this time to reconnect with our kids and families and to see everyone healthy and well. At the same time, it feels like a farewell.

At Rolling Hills, school is 100% in session remotely and has been for weeks. Learning continues with teachers, parents, and students connected, engaged, and working together. Let's finish strong!
